text: over the past 3 months I spent over £700 on some of the most popular running products that influencers are promoting I've been on a mission to see if they live up to the hype that they claim or beetroot in it as well so you could potentially check that out so my rating for this i' definitely give this four out of five and I totally will be keeping up taking it I'm not going to be able to nights a week so four out of five super expensive but does seem to be making a difference next up we are talking about this this is the Thea gun mini version 2 RP of £175 though I bought this one on which is just like the basic entry level one a couple years ago it was a bit of a pain to travel with and charging it up and always lose a stupid charger for it so I bought the mini so I could travel with it charge it up really easily cuz it's USBC so what you get in the package is obviously the theun mini you also get the USBC cable um three different heads that you can snap on and then snap back off again this runs at three different speeds there's some lights on the side here these LEDs those light up with increasing different speeds and then finally the other fact is it's 12 mm of amplitude there so I've been using this to warm up before my runs using it for some recovery after my runs the first like for this is actually not the the massage gun itself but the app that it comes with on your Android or iPhone whatever it just syns up so perfectly to the device with bluetooth the biggest issue for most people using massage guns is they just don't know how to use it now I'm not an expert I'm learning like everybody else but so many people hurt themselves by using these things badly using too much pressure in the wrong sort of places the app is really good it guides you through you've got videos in there it tells you how much pressure to use where to place it and everything like that for the problems that you're having in that particular point in time it's just very easy to use when you know how so I definitely recommend use the app if you're going to be using one of the the body products and I think if you even if you don't have a massage gun from theab body you can still use the app obviously it won't control it and it won't speak to each other but you can get some really good guides on there for how to use things second like USBC is just just so much easier to travel with I've been traveling loads with this we've been on planes driving in the car it's gone through security absolutely fine in hand luggage no issues anywhere in all of the travels and the battery life has been pretty good I've been getting at least 2 hours out of this which is lasting sort of about 10 days of use probably 10 days to 2 weeks of use so I really don't even have to charge it up that much and I genuinely feel better by using it I've had a lot of issues at the start of this year from driving my car getting really bad super type hip flexors I really put a lot of credit into this device for helping sort that out I mean I can do a bit more driving than I want to do so this goes with me pretty much every time I go on a long car Journey this thing's coming with me I can charge up in the car stop every hour or so and just go through my hip flexors and then my final like is it's pretty powerful it's surprisingly powerful probably not going to be if you're a massive Burly weightlifter or something like that it might have struggle to get through your sort of muscles but for people like myself and the vast majority of Runners out there it's going to have more than enough power to look after your muscles but as always it's not all smiles my dislikes with this it doesn't come with a plug so you're going to need to have one of those like little adapter boxes to be able to charge it up and you can certainly apply more pressure with a more normal shaped massage gun the way you hold this it's not the best thing but it's super convenient and easy to travel with it's obviously quite expensive if you buy it for full RP so are there alternatives to this of course there are the main one being like the Bob and gr Bob and gr the Bob and Brad massage gun let me know if you've used that you can obviously use your foam roller at the gym or at home if you're going a little bit more old school or of course get a Weekly massage if you can every two weeks 3 weeks 1 month whatever you can do whatever you can afford that is going to help you out way more having some some actual human go through your body than these sort of things can but it's a nice thing for me to keep everything ticking over between saying my regular massage therapist so my rating for this I really really quite impressed because it's helped sort out so many little problems I've been having dayto day so four and a half out of five and will I keep using it yeah this is coming everywhere with me we good friends traveling around the world together right just going to have a quick drink if talking about aftershocks next right aftershocks as my girlfriend is just behind the camera has reminded me they're not called aftershocks anymore they are just called shocks these sent me back £60 if you don't know what these are thinking what the hell is he waving around these are headphones basically for active people Runners cyclists Walkers well that's certainly how they brand them on their website these used bone conduction Technologies they sit on the side of your head like that and I'm going to read this because it's really complicated but if you're wondering how they work they convert sound into mechanical vibrations that are transmitted through the skin and the temporal bone to the clear basically these pods on the side of these headphones vibrate and they go through your bones and you can hear them what do you get in the Box well you get the cable the charging cable the traveling case and the headphones as well they come in two different sizes for different size head shapes they charge up super quick you can go from n to 60% in around about 20 minutes and they'll be fully charged in one hour the battery lasts about 10 hours so let's chat about my likes one the sound quality for listening to podcasts and any sort of spoken word audiobooks and things like that is pretty good my second like is the safety aspect of these because there's nothing actually in your ears you can hear of any potential dangers traffic other people cyclist whatever around you and you can also use these pretty much all the time in races you still need to check with the race organizer but pretty much every race certainly here in the UK you can use aftershocks even when headphones are banned because the safety aspect you can hear medical people you can hear directions and stuff from everything going on around you you can also connect these up to any phone any watch so you don't have to take your phone with you if you just want to connect it to your garment and listen to the music on that that works absolutely fine also super comfortable you could easily wear these all day without any problem at all some people also like to use these in like office environments and things if I've got a call in the house this is normally what I'll be reaching for battery life as we touched earlier really good as well they also do work well in heavy rain I've never had a problem I've never had a pair break I think this is my third pair I've just upgraded so the build quality of these things is superb let's have a chat about some dislikes well because they're not properly in your ears the sound quality for music isn't great especially the bass I've got the like the pro version here which is meant to have a bit of better bass if you want to listen to music you're a big audio file these are definitely not the headphones to be going for also you really can't hear much if you are in a noisy environment the whole point of the safety thing you can hear the dangers but if you're obviously they're still in good shape here but when I did a bit of research online some people that had said it was really quite good and they're having some positive experiences and then finally when metadata.title: I Spent £700 On Running Influencer Products... (my HONEST thoughts)
